comment.text: This translation key is used to display a label for rooms that can only be viewed, typically in a filtering or search interface. It appears as a filter option on pages like the Home page's Filter section, allowing users to select view-only rooms. Translators should aim for an accurate and descriptive phrase that maintains the intended accessibility and functionality of the UI component.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Yalnız baxın" doesn't accurately convey the meaning of "View-only." It literally translates to "Just look," which is not the intended restriction.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more accurate translation would be something like "Tək baxış" (Tek baxış) or "Sərfəli olmayan redaktə" (Non-editable view) to indicate a read-only access.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The German translation 'Schreibgeschützt' while technically meaning 'write-protected' or 'write-protected', doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'View-only' in the context of rooms. It implies a restriction on writing, not simply viewing.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like 'Nur-Anzeigen', 'Nur-Lesen', or 'Ansicht-Modus' to better reflect 'View-only'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Միայն դիտելու համար" while literal, doesn't fully capture the concise meaning of "View-only". It's a bit verbose. A more natural translation might be something like "Դիտողական" or "Դիտման համար միայն" depending on the overall context and desired formality.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like "Դիտողական" or "Դիտման համար միայն".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "読み取り専用" is technically correct for 'view-only' but lacks nuance and might be too formal/technical for a user-facing setting. A more natural and user-friendly translation might be preferable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 検討: 閲覧専用, 表示専用, または文脈に合わせたより自然な表現

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "ເບິ່ງເທົ່ານັ້ນ" (bèng tèu nán) is understandable, it translates more literally to 'view only' or 'look only'. It lacks the nuance of 'View-only' which implies a permission level or restriction. A more accurate translation would depend on the specific context, but a better option might be something like 'ຊັດເຊັນການເບິ່ງ' (sèt-sèn gaan bèng) which translates to 'restricted viewing' or 'read-only viewing'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'ຊັດເຊັນການເບິ່ງ' (sèt-sèn gaan bèng) or a similarly nuanced translation depending on the context.  Consult with a Lao language expert to ensure accuracy.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Apenas ver" is a literal translation but doesn't fully capture the nuance of "View-only." It's somewhat awkward and doesn't convey the restriction of viewing only.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more descriptive translation like "Somente visualização" or "Apenas para visualização" to better communicate the intended meaning.  "Visualização apenas" is also an option.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Просмотр" while technically meaning 'viewing' or 'view', doesn't accurately convey the nuance of 'View-only'. 'View-only' implies a restriction; the user can only view, not interact.  'Просмотр' lacks this implication of restriction.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more accurate translation would be something that implies restriction, such as "Только просмотр" (Only view) or "Просмотр только" (View only) or "Чтение" (Read-only, if the context allows). The best option depends on the broader context of the Key's usage.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Iba prezeranie" is understandable, it's not the most natural or idiomatic translation of "View-only." It lacks the nuance of restricting access to viewing only.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider "Len na prezeranie" or "Pouze na zobrazenie" for a more accurate translation. A more detailed explanation might be necessary depending on the context to convey the restriction fully.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation 'Само-за-преглед' does not accurately convey the meaning of 'View-only'. It literally translates to something like 'Self-for-review' which is nonsensical in this context. 'View-only' implies a restriction where users can only view, not edit or modify.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more accurate translation would be 'Само-за-гледање' (Samo-za-gledanje) or 'Више само за гледање' (Vishe samo za gledanje).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation "Samo-za-pregled" does not accurately convey the meaning of "View-only". It's a literal string concatenation that doesn't make sense in Serbian. "View-only" implies read-only access.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A better translation would be "Više samo za pregled" (More read-only), "Samo za prelistavanje" (Just for browsing), or a more specific term depending on the context of the application.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Sadece görüntüleme" is understandable, it's not the most natural or idiomatic translation for "View-only." It's a bit literal.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like "Yalnızca görüntüleme", "Sadece okuma", or "Sadece izleme" depending on the specific context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "仅查看" (jin chakan) while technically meaning 'only view', doesn't fully capture the nuance of 'View-only'. It implies a limitation but doesn't explicitly state that editing is not permitted. A more accurate translation would convey the restriction on modification.
